intro: Taraxacum kegnaesense, commonly known as the Kegnaes dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to northern Europe and is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and a yellow flower head that matures into a spherical seed sphere. The plant is typically found in open, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It has a taproot system and is known for its ability to spread through wind-dispersed seeds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its ecological adaptability and potential horticultural value.
